page.title: 16SCHOOL HISTORY (LAMPHEY)
page.content: The first school in Lamphey was built near the church.The car park in front of the church was the playground.There was one big roomwith desks arranged in tiers.In 1910 a new council school was built with three rooms.Children started school when they were five and stayed until they were fourteen.Bright children who passed the scholarship exam went to the grammar school in Pembroke Dock.Some children had to walk 2 miles to school from Freshwater East,Trewent and Manorbier Newton. There were no school meals before 1940.The children brought jam or bacon sandwiches and billy cans of cold tea which were heated in front of the fire in time for luinch at twelve o'clock. There were no indoor toilets and the children had to walk 75 yards across the playground if they needed to go to the toilet.
